msgSnippet: Hi, How can it help inside the after test method that located in base test class ? Thanks ... -- View this message in context:
messageBody:
Hi,

How can it help inside the after test method that located in base test class
?

Thanks


adrian.kuhn wrote:
>
> Your logging framework can use Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace() to
> figure out the
> name of the test from which it is being called.
>
> cheers,
> AA
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, idan72 <ishai@...> wrote:
>>
>>
>> Hi,
>>
>> Just to be clear I need to know the name of test in the after method not
>> in
>> the listener.
>> We are running many tests from different classes and we want to split the
>> logs for each test to different file.
>> For this we need to know that @BeforeClass or @AfterClass is called.
>> We also want to make several operation at the end of each test.
>> Each test class is extend of general class that containg after test
>> method.
>> We need to know in this method what is name of the test method.
>>
>> What is the not standard way to achive this ?
>> You said that a change may be soon.Can you tell when ?
>>
>>
>>
>> Thanks
>> Idan
>>
>>
>>
>> kentb wrote:
>> >
>> > In JUnit 3 finding the test name was easy, just look at fName. In JUnit
>> 4
>> > there is not standard way to find out. The listener does know which
>> test
>> > is
>> > running, via the Description.
>> >
>> > The listener is not notified when calling @Before and @After methods,
>> but
>> > this may change because I've been wishing to be notified as part of my
>> > data
>> > gathering efforts.
>> >
>> > I'm curious what problem you are solving.
>> >
>> > Regards,
>> >
>> > Kent Beck
